perturbation.original_text:
Upon the death of the Employee while this Agreement is in force, the Employee's beneficiary as named in the Beneficiary Designation Form on page
6 (or as it may be amended according to the terms set forth on page 6) for this Agreement will be entitled to receive from the Policy proceeds an
amount equal to the lesser of: (a) (two (2) times the Employee's annualized base salary at the time of death as provided by the Employer's payroll
department) plus $100,000, reduced by any amount payable under the Employer's group term life insurance plan, or (b) the Net Amount At Risk.
perturbation.changed_text:
Upon the death of the Employee while this Agreement is in force, the Employee's beneficiary as named in the Beneficiary Designation Form on page
6 (or as it may be amended according to the terms set forth on page 6) for this Agreement will be entitled to receive from the Policy proceeds an
amount equal to the lesser of: (a) (two (2) times the Employee's annualized base salary at the time of death as provided by the Employer's payroll
department) plus $100,000, reduced by any amount payable under the Employer's group term life insurance plan, or (b) the Net Amount At Risk.  However, in no case shall the beneficiary receive less than $50,000 regardless of the calculation.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction. The original clause states the beneficiary receives the lesser of two calculated amounts. The added sentence guarantees a minimum payout of $50,000, potentially overriding the 'lesser of' clause and creating ambiguity about the actual payout amount.

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement may be terminated at any time while the Employee is living by written notice thereof by either the Employer or the Employee to the
other; and, in any event, this Agreement will terminate upon termination of the Employee's employment.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement may be terminated at any time while the Employee is living by written notice thereof by either the Employer or the Employee to the
other; and, in any event, this Agreement will terminate upon termination of the Employee's employment. However, if the Employer terminates the agreement within the first year, they are liable for a penalty equal to 10% of the initial premium payments made.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a contradiction. The original clause allows termination at any time with written notice, implying no penalty. The added sentence introduces a penalty for the Employer if termination occurs within the first year. This creates uncertainty about the actual terms of termination and whether a penalty applies.

perturbation.original_text:
The Employer will keep possession of the Policies. The Employer agrees from time to time to make the policies available to the Employee or to the
"Insurer" for the purpose of endorsing or filing any change of beneficiary on the Policies but the Policies will promptly be returned to the Employer.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Employer will keep possession of the Policies. The Employer agrees from time to time to make the policies available to the Employee or to the
"Insurer" for the purpose of endorsing or filing any change of beneficiary on the Policies. The Employee shall have the right to retain possession of the policies for up to 30 days for personal review.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction. Initially, the Employer retains possession, with temporary access granted to the Employee for specific purposes like endorsements, with prompt return expected. The added sentence allows the Employee to retain the policy for up to 30 days for personal review. This directly contradicts the 'promptly returned' clause, creating ambiguity regarding possession rights and duration.
